intro: Crucianella gilanica subsp. kotschyi, commonly known as the Gilan crucianella, is a flowering plant species native to parts of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its fruit is a small, capsule that disperses seeds through wind or animal activity. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
